content.description: This is a sit start extension to rail runners. Start with your left hand on a big edge with a thumb catch, and your right hand on a bomber undercling. First move is a dynamic throw, and then work your way up from there. Slightly overhung and on a slanted landing.

The West arete of this boulder is the longest problem here and, while easy, is pretty cool. Most holds are slopers and the landing is unfavorable, so a pad and a spotter would be great here.

Be aware especially in the summer, you have to walk through a lot of tall weeds and this is great rattlesnake territory.

The boulder is probably 6 feet away from the train track, so you probably want to get off it if a train comes.
content.location: Get here by going straight onto the dirt pullout/road at the North end of the 20mph curve right before the Lake Point wall. Walk toward the train track. The longest section of this is the West arete.

content.description: Start on a ledge kind of in the middle of the rock, and work your way up from there. Easy fun. Landing is a bit slanted. Falling is unlikely though. Can also do a different route by going right from the ledge instead of left. Also V-easy. Slightly more than vertical, topping out is fun.
Start on two underclings. Move to the right and over the tiny roof.
content.location: Same as Railroad boulder, Bone Appetit, etc.

content.description: Good landing mostly. Start on a left hand undercling/side pull, and right hand side pull. Basically a wide armed gaston, and dynamically throw your right hand to a two inch ledge with good texture. After that it's a walk up the rock. Only V0- because the first move is a little tricky. Would be V-easy otherwise.
content.location: Same way as getting to the railroad boulder. Just around the rock corner.
